item.title: Through a Glass, Darkly: Monetary Policy under Uncertainty (tentative)
Unconventional Policy in a Low Interest Rate Environment
Restoring Existence and Uniqueness at the Effective Lower Bound with Simple Fiscal Policy

item.title: CBDCs, Financial Inclusion, and Optimal Monetary Policy
item.description: We use a New Keynesian DSGE model to explore the financial inclusion tradeoffs of extending a retail-indirect CBDC to the unbanked, as well as optimal monetary considerations.

item.title: Cryptocurrencies in Emerging Markets: A Stablecoin Solution?
item.description: We study the macroeconomic effects of introducing cryptocurrencies in a workhorse small open economy model. Cryptocurrency adoption attenuates both domestic and foreign monetary policy transmission, and flexible exchange rates provide an effective buffer against cryptocurrency price shocks. Our findings motivate the increasing use of stablecoins in emerging markets as a hedge against macroeconomic uncertainty.

item.title: Gone with the Wind: Monetary Policy and the Global Financial Cycle
item.description: Using a SOE NK model with an international banking sector, I explore the validity of the trilemma-dilemma debate and global financial cycles. I then use data from South Korea to estimate the model with Bayesian methods.

item.title: Productivity over the Life-Cycle and its Effects on the Interest Rate
item.description: We use an OTANK model to explore the relationship between productivity, demographic shifts, and interest rates in Japan for the post-bubble era.
